title: Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The person conducting the interview was friendly and made the process a comfortable situation. However, they were suppose to let me know either way the outcome of the interview but I never received any information.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: very calming, and very reassuring. makes you feel very confident about the job and the position. definitely loved the process. also was a fast and easy interview. made me feel very proud to apply for this job.

title: Several Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had several different interviews for various positions.  Went to job fair and interviewed for talent acquisition specialist and release of information clerk. I recommend going ahead and applying before you go to the job fair because if not, they don’t have your prior experience to look at and they may not seriously consider you. I did get a second interview for both positions with the hiring manager though. I also interviewed for multiple scribe positions and for unit secretary and I had another scheduled for precertification specialist on Monday. The interviews were all extremely long and in depth. They asked questions about why you want to work for PMC, to tell about something that can’t be determined from your application, to tell about a time you made a mistake and how you handled it, etc. They all asked the same questions. There were a couple that didn’t go as long as the rest so I guess maybe they weren’t that interested. Idk. But all in all I’ve spent over 8 hours of the last week interviewing there.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work at PMC?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple. Standard questions. Took awhile to be offered an interview and only heard back after I reached out. You’d think the process would be a tad quicker for a company hurting for employees.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult situation with a patient in the past?

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and laid back, it was as one on one interview in the interviewers office. She was very nice and understanding, she really just wanted to get to know me as a person.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly managers. The interview was a fair, fast, and easy process. The questions were simple and pointed to the job being offered. They asked a few questions unrelated to the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in this field?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR, Interview with actual boss, wait a while, get a lowball offer and laughed at. They called back and offered my original asking salary, but I didn't accept.
Interview Questions: Pretty generic interview questions with HR.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was very simple. I did a phone interview and face to face. I had to drive to Pikeville. Expense paid for. Interview was really good. People are friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why should we hire you for this position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. They brought someone from the floor for me to ask questions to. It was 3 people total interviewing me. They were all kind and explained that the process might take a while.
Interview Questions: How do i handle stressful situations?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY)
Interview Descriptions:
Took almost 2 months to get an interview after I applied. After interview took 12 days for them to offer.
Was given choice of day or night. Start date was a month later.
Interview Questions: What about your previous job did you not like

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was introduced to various clinic managers and asked what days I could work and times. I was shown around one clinic and the hospital itself which was very nice.
Interview Questions: What is something you would change about yourself?

title: Legal Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was friendly.  Two people ask me questions about experience and told me to take a drug test after the interview. I thought I did well. Unfortunately, I wasn’t offered the position, but the overall interview wasn’t bad.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at PMC?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very comfortable and very easy going. I didn’t feel intimataded at all. She made me feel very confident, I really felt like it was going to be a good fit.
Interview Questions: How would you work in the Christian environment?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: peer interview, director interview, hr interview.  drug test back ground check, tb skin test.  call back followed by training for 2 weeks off site then training with a peer on the floor
Interview Questions: how have you overcome something in the past

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: You have to do three interviews, the first is done by Human Resources, the second is your boss and the third is a peer interview. Its your basic interview questions. They ask you more about your availability and willingness to work.
Interview Questions: What are some of your best qualities?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was painless. They constantly need CNAs on all of their floors. I received a call 20 minutes after I applied through their internet portal and was offered an interview and tour of the Rehab Floor. I would suggest working on 7 or 6 if the option is available.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested on working on IPR?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pikeville Medical Center (Pikeville, KY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: i was interviewd at pmc for a job opening for a nursing assistant, and still havent heard nothing back from the supervisors, i really need this job and i am certified and trying to make my way through college to be a registerd nurse
Interview Questions: what values could you bring to pmc?
